articles.headline: At Goldman, He’s David Solomon. At the Club, He’s D.J. D-Sol.
articles.snippet: A co-president and a leading contender to become the investment bank’s chief executive has a surprising hobby.
articles.abstract: A co-president and a leading contender to become the investment bank’s chief executive has a surprising hobby.
articles.lead_paragraph: On a sunny afternoon in the Bahamas this month, dozens of beachgoers mingled and danced to a soundtrack mixed by a man using a Pioneer sound system on a platform at the local tiki bar.

articles.headline: In Lula’s Shadow, Brazil’s Shipbuilders Struggle to Right Themselves
articles.snippet: The country’s plans were undone by widespread graft, weak commodity prices and a naïveté over how to succeed in a competitive industry.
articles.abstract: The country’s plans were undone by widespread graft, weak commodity prices and a naïveté over how to succeed in a competitive industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: NITERÓI, Brazil — The city of Niterói, near Rio de Janeiro, features an unusual landmark: two unfinished oil tankers emblazoned with the green and yellow of Brazil’s state-run oil company, Petrobras.

articles.headline: In Brazil, Political Rivals Face a Common Threat: A Rising Judiciary
articles.snippet: Amid the conviction of Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, political adversaries across the ideological spectrum are attacking the legitimacy of prosecutors and judges.
articles.abstract: Amid the conviction of Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, political adversaries across the ideological spectrum are attacking the legitimacy of prosecutors and judges.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — It was anything but a surrender.
articles.byline: By Ernesto Londoño and Shannon Sims

articles.headline: Ruling Threatens Hong Kong’s Independence From China
articles.snippet: A court removing four lawmakers assures China greater influence over Hong Kong’s government at least until by-elections are held.
articles.abstract: A court removing four lawmakers assures China greater influence over Hong Kong’s government at least until by-elections are held.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Nearly three years after sweeping pro-democracy protests filled the streets of Hong Kong, a local court delivered the struggling movement a severe blow on Friday, removing four legislators from office and assuring China greater influence over the city’s government.

articles.headline: How the Medicaid Debate Affects Long-Term Care Insurance Decisions
articles.snippet: Big cuts to Medicaid are still in the Senate’s health insurance bill. How might you pay for your care in old age if the government can’t or won’t?
articles.abstract: Big cuts to Medicaid are still in the Senate’s health insurance bill. How might you pay for your care in old age if the government can’t or won’t?
articles.lead_paragraph: The latest version of the Senate’s health insurance bill appeared on Thursday, and it didn’t do much to change the drastic reductions in Medicaid spending that were in the original legislation.

articles.headline: TPP, the Trade Deal Trump Killed, Is Back in Talks Without U.S.
articles.snippet: Japan and the 10 other remaining countries in the Trans-Pacific Partnership are trying to press ahead without the United States.
articles.abstract: Japan and the 10 other remaining countries in the Trans-Pacific Partnership are trying to press ahead without the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — When President Trump pulled out of his predecessor’s signature trade deal on his first full weekday in office, the 11 other countries that had negotiated the pact were left wondering if years of work had just gone down the drain.
